glosses: Said in disbelief that a hopeless situation is to improve until a very long time in the future or ever

etymology: Shortened version of ölme eşeğim ölme yaza yonca bitecek (literally, “don't die, my donkey, don't die, clover will sprout in summer”), of similar meaning to the Greek ζήσε Μάη μου να φας τριφύλλι (zíse Mái mou na fas trifýlli), both recorded by Levinus Warner already in the mid-17ᵗʰ c.
